6217.verse-arabic: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ تَبَّتْ يَدَا أَبِي لَهَبٍ وَتَبَّ
6217.verse-english: May the hands of Abu Lahab be ruined, and ruined is he.

clauses-english.clause: May the hands of Abu Lahab be ruined,

6218.verse-arabic: مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُ مَالُهُ وَمَا كَسَبَ
6218.verse-english: His wealth will not avail him or that which he gained.

clauses-arabic.clause: مَا أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُ مَالُهُ وَمَا كَسَبَ

clauses-english.clause: His wealth will not avail him or that which he gained.

6219.verse-english: He will [enter to] burn in a Fire of [blazing] flame

clauses-english.clause: He will [enter to] burn in a Fire of [blazing] flame

6220.verse-english: And his wife [as well] - the carrier of firewood.

6221.verse-english: Around her neck is a rope of [twisted] fiber.

clauses-english.clause: Around her neck is a rope of [twisted] fiber.
